clinical_study.brief_title: Anesthesic Propofol and Remifentanil Requirements in Obese Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Intravenous Anesthesia in Obese Patients: Propofol and Remifentanil Requirements

brief_summary.textblock: Pharmacokinetic models for anesthetic agents are questionable. The objective of the study is to compare the propofol and remifentanil doses required to maintain the bispectral index in the range 40-60 in two groups of patients: obese patients and lean patients

secondary_outcome.measure: remifentanil requirement, hemodynamic profile, time to extubation, performances of the automated system of propofol and remifentanil deliver

intervention.description: total intra-venous anesthesia (propofol and remifentanil) being delivered using a close-loop system with the Bispectral Index as the single input for the controller
total intra-venous anesthesia (propofol and remifentanil) being delivered using a closed-loop system with the Bispectral Index as the single input for the controller

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients scheduled for a bariatric coelioscopic surgical procedure (obese patients) or for an upper abdominal laparoscopic procedure (lean patients)
Exclusion Criteria:
- age lower than 18 years,
- pregnant woman,
- presence of a central neurological disorder or a lesion cerebral, of a severe respiratory or hepatic insufficiency,
- allergy to propofol, or to soja or to peanuts, or to sufentanil, or to remifentanil, or to morphine, or to a muscle myorelaxant, or to an excipient,
- hypersensibility to sufentanil, or to remifentanil or to another derivate of fentanyl,
- allergy to latex,
- presence of a symptomatic gastroesophageal reflux,
- patients receiving a psychotropic treatment or a agonist-antagonist opiate,
- presence of predictive signs of difficult mask ventilation of difficult intubation (else than obesity)
